docs.snippet: The American entertainer commonly known as Mos Def has 14 days to leave South Africa after he was arrested for violating local immigration laws while trying to leave the country, a government spokesman said Friday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The American entertainer commonly known as Mos Def has 14 days to leave South Africa after he was arrested for violating local immigration laws while trying to leave the country, a government spokesman said Friday.

headline.main: US Rapper Mos Def Arrested at South African Airport
headline.print_headline: US Rapper Mos Def Arrested at South African Airport

headline.main: First of 8,000 Stranded Cuban Migrants Cross Into US

docs.snippet: Senator Ted Cruz of Texas calling out Donald Trump for the apparent high crime of “embodying New York values” presents us with the politics of hypocrisy....
docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Ted Cruz of Texas calling out Donald Trump for the apparent high crime of “embodying New York values” presents us with the politics of hypocrisy.
docs.abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column underscores Sen Ted Cruz's hypocrisy during latest Republican presidential primary debate for criticizing so-called New York values; notes what is most galling about statement is that Cruz also claimed Donald J Trump embodies New York values, when fact is only thing Trump values is himself.

headline.main: Ted Cruz and Donald Trump’s Familiar Feud Over New York
headline.print_headline: Cruz’s Jab at Trump, and the Politics of Hypocrisy

byline.contributor: Susan C. Beachy and Kitty Bennett contributed research.

docs.snippet: Before the violent assaults on women in Cologne on New Year’s Eve, the police thought their biggest worry would be pickpocketing and fireworks among the crowds....
docs.lead_paragraph: Before the violent assaults on women in Cologne on New Year’s Eve, the police thought their biggest worry would be pickpocketing and fireworks among the crowds.
docs.abstract: Sexual assaults and robberies by 1,500 men, many of them immigrants, against women in Cologne, Germany, on New Year's Eve points up police miscalculation in dealing with up to million asylum seekers, most from war-riven Muslim countries with different cultures; Germany faces challenge of integrating vast new population amid decreasing tolerance.

headline.main: As Germany Welcomes Migrants, Sexual Attacks in Cologne Point to a New Reality
headline.print_headline: Cologne Attacks Highlight Clash Among Cultures

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis

byline.contributor: Laura Fauss, Katarina Johannsen and Victor Homola contributed reporting from Berlin.

docs.snippet: Even now, after aid agencies negotiated to bring food and supplies to Madaya, there is little hope for change in a place trying to function while under siege....
docs.lead_paragraph: Even now, after aid agencies negotiated to bring food and supplies to Madaya, there is little hope for change in a place trying to function while under siege.
docs.abstract: International aid workers say hundreds of residents of Madaya, Syria, are in desperate need of food and medicine; town has been under siege by government forces since July 2015, even as residents await further deliveries of food, medicine and aid; United Nations estimates 400,000 in country are trapped behind battle lines by government, Islamic State or rival insurgents.

headline.main: In Syrian Town Cut Off From the World, Glimpses of Deprivation
headline.print_headline: Isolated, Starving and Losing Hope in Syria

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce contributed reporting from Geneva.
byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and HWAIDA SAAD
